intro: Hydrocotyle schlechteri, commonly known as the marsh mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies. It has a rhizomatous root system that allows it to spread vegetatively. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
